column2: Difficulty with motivation to achieve goals. A potential lack of self-confidence to set personal goals. A general lack of enthusiasm and a feeling of being overwhelmed by change.

Highly motivated with many goals and aspirations. Vital and spontaneous, often enjoying new and adventurous challenges. Irrepressible enthusiasm. A weakness for exaggeration and an inability to cope with mundane activities.
Difficulty coping with the realities of everyday life. Practical daily chores seem beyond capability, and there is difficulty concentrating on matters at hand.

Practical, efficient, and hands-on. A reliable, common-sense approach to most matters. A down-to-earth manner well-suited for the daily chores of life. A weakness for a sometimes stubborn refusal to make changes. A tendency to stifle enthusiasm in oneself and others.
A lack of objectivityâ€”the ability to stand back and view aspects of life from a detached and rational perspective. Difficulty making decisions and weighing pros and cons in a logical manner.

Objective and philosophical, preferring to view life from an intellectual perspective. The rational mind outweighs feelings, as the world of emotions is considered irrational. A high sense of fairness and a logical thought process. A weakness for viewing emotions in a disparaging light.

Disconnected from emotions. A horror of crying or losing composure in front of other people. A frequent lack of compassion in human relationships, and a need to learn to honor feelings in oneself and others.

Compassionate and caring with a strong intuitional nature. Values personal relationships, often taking on a caretaker role. So sympathetic and understanding as to be often caught in the role of mother to loved ones. A weakness for failing to take an objective perspective when necessary. A tendency to react without thinking things through first.
